CSGO is a fun game to play with friends, but realistically not competitively. The way valve treats CSGO compared to dota 2 makes it clear that casual competition clearly does not matter to them. If you get some friends to queue together and try to just do dumb stuff to have fun and get a good laugh out of attempting/hitting crazy shots you'll have a much better experience than trying to grind through the ranking system which can be represented simply as cheaters in silver -> people in nova/mg ranks who are warming up for 3rd party competitive systems that are superior to valve's matchmaking -> supreme/global cheaters. I'd recommend the game if you want to have fun, but if you want a competitive game where ranking is fair and anticheat works, you'll need to pay for a 3rd party client such as ESEA or faceit.
